intro: Hieracium haegerstroemii, commonly known as the Haegerström's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and a single, tall stem that bears yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. Native to southern Europe, this species thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. The plant has small, linear leaves and produces seeds through wind dispersal. It is considered a perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and sunny environments.
